text: I posted today's Press+Hold APK, with altered timing to show the full progress bar if the user is still holding down. I'm trying my best to hold the SpeechRecognizer listening up to the 5-second timeout and beyond, but I have tested and confirmed that it seems to stop listening on my Nexus 5 after a shorter silence. At any rate, the UI should be more clear with what's happening during the hold period even if we can't catch any more words.
I started on trying to detect a swipe up to open Timeline, but I haven't yet got that working.
Since we're already detecting touch events in the view hierarchy, adding a swipe up is going to take some more investigating and testing.
The important text there is "Additionally, depending on the recognizer implementation, these values may have no effect." Which seems to be true in the KitKat implementation on my Nexus 5.
Anyway, just some extra info to explain the situation. Have a great weekend and see you Monday!
